result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Ira L Nettles was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Nettles to 7 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  5 years. This sentence is to commence forthwith, concurrent to any sentence in being.
Concurrent with: any sentence in being.

--Alcohol assessment and follow through

--Victim Impact Panel attendance

records.addlTxt: Transcript from 7/21/2022 plea and sentencing hearing
Letter from defendant re case

[MK] case called at 9:44am 
Defendant Ira L Nettles appears by video from Dodge County Correctional Institution, in custody. Attorney Karl Huebner appears by video from a separate location. ADA Michael C. Witt appears in court for State of Wisconsin.  
The Court finds the video-connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
The Court verifies with Mr. Nettles that he understands he has the right to be present in the courtroom for sentencing, and he is waiving this right. 
Mr. Nettles waives his right to Preliminary Hearing.  The Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for trial.
Service of the information is admitted; reading is waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
Pleas of "Not Guilty" are entered. 
_____________________________
Constitutional rights reviewed; elements are recited; plea of  "Guilty " is entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2. 


On Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Nettles to 7 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  5 years. This sentence is to commence forthwith, concurrent to any sentence in being.    
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 1 day credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no ownership, possession, or operation of any motor vehicle
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquors
--if permitted to travel out of state, no possession or use of marijuana (THC) in states where it is legal. No legal CBD products or other legal cannabis derivatives without express permission of the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--to pay a fine of $600 plus costs and surcharges

The Court orders outright:  
--Revocation of operating privileges for 36 months
--Ignition Interlock Device requirement/restrictions pursuant to St. 343.301(1g) for 36 months
--Alcohol assessment and follow through
--Victim Impact Panel attendance 

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form is to be mailed to the Defendant
recess 10:19am
[Post-Hearing/Off-Record: in response to the clerk's inquiry regarding case numbering when there are felony charges involved, the Court authorizes the clerk to renumber the case if/as needed. ]
No address or telephone number provided on bond
Notice of Court Order to Jefferson County Dispatch
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

--no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without valid drivers license

[Court Reporter: Cindy Baumeister]
[ma] Case called at 1:36pm   {This hearing is being conducted via Zoom videoconferencing.}
 
Defendant Ira L Nettles appears via videoconferencing from DCI, in custody. Attorney Karl Huebner appears.  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

Bond Arguments given by Counsel.

Atty Flint requests leave to file amended charging document; no objection from Atty Huebner; the Court grants leave. 

Service of AmendedComplaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Pleas of Not Guilty entered; No request for speedy trial

The Court amends bond to relieve Mr. Nettles of SCRAM requirement. 

recess 1:46  pm. 

NEXT: Waiver of Preliminary Hearing/Plea & Sentencing on 7/21/22 at 11:15am (Mr. Nettles to appear via video)
Voluntary appearance on July 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Request for hearing granted
Request for hearing

[MK] case called at 3:13pm 
Defendant Ira L Nettles in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Huebner indicates that he has not had any contact with Mr. Nettles.  ADA Beck indicates that it appears Mr. Nettles may be in the Waukesha County Jail, and that there is a warrant active in Walworth County for Mr. Nettles. 
On Motion of the state, the Court authorizes a Warrant returnable to any Jefferson County magistrate. The Court notes that when Mr. Nettles appears, there is an Amended Bond has did not sign. 
recess 3:15pm
Status conference on December 16, 2021 at 02:30 pm.

Amended Bond. Conditions of this Bond include: 
--no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without valid drivers license
--Mr. Nettles is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet. The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  The Defendant is to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on the afternoon of Thursday November 4th, not later than 3:00pm in the afternoon.  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**
--Mr. Nettles is to report to the Clerk of Courts Office by Thursday November 4th at 4:00pm to sign the Amended Bond.

[MK; Appearances are by Zoom conference] 
case called at 1:34pm 
Defendant Ira L Nettles appears by audio. Attorney Karl Huebner appears.  ADA Garrett Johnson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This hearing is scheduled on the State's 10/22/21 Motion to Modify Bond. 
Arguments are given by ADA Johnson.
The Court modifies the Bond to add the condition of Scram monitoring.  The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.  The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  The Defendant is to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on the afternoon of Thursday November 4th, not later than 3:00pm in the afternoon.  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**
The court requires Mr. Nettles to report to Clerk of Courts Office by Thursday November 4th at 4:00pm to sign the Amended Bond.  
recess 1:41pm

NEXT:  Status Conference on December 16th at 2:30pm
Motion hearing on November 2, 2021 at 01:30 pm.

[ae] case called 10:15 AM Defendant Ira L Nettles appeared by telephone. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant informs the Court that he is ill with Covid and wishes to go forward with Initial Appearance today
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Pleas of "not guilty" are entered; speedy trial waived 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $500 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without valid drivers license 
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs) after signing of this bond

Defendant is to sign bond by 9/1/21, failure to do so will result in a warrant being issued.
